name: St. John Paul II
summary: John Paul II, born Karol Józef Wojtyła, was Pope from 1978 to 2005. He was the first non-Italian pope in 455 years and the first Polish pope. His 27-year pontificate was one of the longest in history. He traveled extensively, visiting 129 countries. He played a crucial role in the fall of communism in Eastern Europe. He promulgated the 1983 Code of Canon Law and the Catechism of the Catholic Church (1992). He canonized more saints than all previous popes combined. He was shot in an assassination attempt in 1981 but survived. He was canonized in 2014, along with John XXIII.
